greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest Riesel number that is divisible by the n-th prime.
comment: Some examples of Riesel numbers that are divisible by 3 are in A187714.
For an odd prime p and odd k, if p divides k, then p does not divide k*2^n - 1 for any n.
link: Arkadiusz Wesolowski, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
Chris Caldwell, The Prime Glossary, Riesel number
example: 1254341 is first Riesel number that is divisible by 11, the 5th prime - so a(5) = 1254341.
results.author: _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Jun 13 2012
ext: Offset changed and initial term added by _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, May 11 2017
